result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called for status. 
Defense requests time for investigation and medical testing.
Hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

9:09 AM Defendant David J Haddix in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for David J Haddix. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. 
Defense has not received discovery the State sent at the end of July.
State to re-send discovery and make a pre-trial offer. 
Defendant is trying to get into a counseling programming program.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

03:25 PM Defendant David J Haddix in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Niki Kane, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called to address Motion to Modify Bond filed by Atty Kershek on 7/19/22.
Defense requests removal of CAM monitoring for reasons as stated on the record.
State objects to modification of bond.
Court denies the motion at this time for reasons as stated on the record.
Court advises the parties that there is a distant connection to the Defendant. 
The next hearing date scheduled at the prior hearing will remain on the calendar. 
The Court expects an update report from WCS prior to the next hearing.

03:34 PM Defendant David J Haddix in court, in custody.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Alyssa Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The defendant states he intends on retaining private counsel.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  The defendant is ordered to appear in person at the next hearing.
